messages.message:
i see this error for Cypress tests using <mailto:support-testing+jenkins-org-user@instabase.com|support-testing+jenkins-org-user@instabase.com> on aihub-uat.internal.instabse.com (http://aihub-uat.internal.instabse.com) (example (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/20968/test-results/02033965-f49f-48fc-aeb9-5c19134249d2/replay?actions=%5B%5D&att=1&browsers=%5B%5D&groups=%5B%5D&isFlaky=%5B%5D&modificationDateRange=%7B%22startDate%22:%221970-01-01%22,%22endDate%22:%222038-01-19%22%7D&orderBy=EXECUTION_ORDER&oses=%5B%5D&pc=log-https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com-693__command-logs&specs=%5B%7B%22label%22:%22apps/src/aihub/__e2e__/Landing/send-product-feedback.spec.ts%22,%22value%22:%22%5B%5C%22808c8c5d-269e-46a4-a802-9000d130341b%5C%22%5D%22%7D%5D&statuses=%5B%5D&testingTypesEnum=%5B%5D&ts=1753453076593.7998))
```Error: License validation failed for user support-testing.jenkins-org-user_instabase.com (http://support-testing.jenkins-org-user_instabase.com). If you are using a Commercial account, please specify your organization name in the IB-Context header.```
but when i manually log in as this user, i don't see this error :confused_dog:  (see screenshot)

any suggestions? maybe we should just remove this Cypress test since we're not showing the google form anymore anyways, right? @Xindi Xu

Yea, all requests sent from Cypress need to have the IB-context header set to the org now.
When we log in via browser, we have the interceptor logic to set the IB-context for every fetch fn.
Probably that user's community license is expired. We can extend it for now.
ok so another reason that we're getting this error is that we log in using `fetch(.../account/login, ...)` in Cypress tests?

Yea, i do have a solution but probably not going to fix it for uat rn.

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72681/files#diff-68d49e03f187b97db383315b8f596e8b95872377332dde4acca79a86d0f78922

Confirmed that this user has no metronome plan, so all tests failed. I added a community plan.

Seems like this user hasn't had a community plan since Oct 17, 2024. It only becomes a problem because we deprecate community context in 25.30
